page.title: 09HOUSING * POPULATION
page.content:
{Housing} About 10% of the people in Firle have bought their house but some cannot afford it. All the land belongs to Lord Gage and residents mainly rent their homes from him. If there was a major housing development most people would be displeased as it would spoil the village.Apart from tied cottages there are some council houses. there are no flat and very few bungalows. All houses have gardens.
{Population } The majority of people in the village are aged between 16 and 60. The pensioners form the next biggest age group followed by the 4-16 year old. The smallest group are the under fours. The total number of people in the village is about 82 people.
